 Terral's reply << That which was stolen from creation is the same 'glory' of the Father that Christ shared with Him "before the world was." John 17:5. That is the glory that creation seeks. Rom. 8:18-21. And thus, Christ is called the "Lord of Glory." 1Cor. 2:8. There is a mystery here relating to how we should pray. Man is to pray with head uncovered, and women pray with head covered. This pertains to the glory of God, image and authority. "For a man ought not to have his head covered, since he is the image and glory of God; but the woman is the glory of man." 1Cor. 11:7. The reason is that man represents the spirit part, and woman the body part. And the two are one flesh. Therefore, the man prays in the likeness of the angels (without body/unclothed). Thus it is written, "Therefore the woman ought to have {a symbol of} authority on her head, because of the angels." 1Cor. 11:10.
 
 Ron << But, in doing so, we must become one with God, we must be Baptized in the Holy Spirit, crucifying the flesh daily. 
 
 Terral's reply << We are not baptized 'in' the Holy Spirit like members of the Kingdom Dispensation. We are baptized 'by' the Holy Spirit 'into' the body of Christ. 1Cor. 12:13. This is how we become active participants in His death, burial and resurrection (Rom. 6:3+4) to become 'clothed with Christ.' Gal. 3:26. Denying the flesh and building up the new spirit nature within us is definitely part of the Christian life. Gal. 5:16-26. Your spirit is to become the head of the flesh in the same way that the man is head of the woman. The body is to become subject to the spirit.
 
 Ron << We must let go of the things that keep us bound to worldly things and step into the spiritual realm.----That's getting off the subject a little, but was required to show why the statement "before the foundation of the world" is related to our salvation.
 
 Terral's reply << Not at all. Although, as stated, the answer seems to be a bit more simple than you describe.
 
 Ron << How does this pertain to the Lamb's Book of Life? Humans are born, just like any other warm-blooded creature, but has one distinct attribute of his own - the soul. The soul is not born, formed from ghostly DNA, it is sent directly from Heaven when we are conceived/formulate/derived from male/female copulation. 
 
 Terral's reply << Perhaps you are absolutely correct, but my view differs a bit. The breath of life (spirit) is that which is from God. Our physical makeup is the inherited traits from our parents (dust of the ground). Then we 'become a living soul' in the process. In other words, our soul is the place where the spirit and body overlap. And this is the seat of our consciousness. All consciousness is the result of the overlapping/joining/marriage of spirit and a physical body that the spirit utilizes as a vehicle of expression. Demonic possession is a detached spirit's attempt at becoming conscious. And whether people are believers or unbelievers, that consciousness is Christ. 
 
 When we place ourselves into the position of obedience (hearing; Rom. 10:17) to the gospel (i.e., the good news pertaining to the death, burial and resurrection of Jesus Christ) then we are baptized into Christ, and into that which has been reconciled from the heavens and the earth already. In the same way that we have three parts of spirit, body and soul, creation has three parts of heavens, earth and heaven. This is in the image of the Father (spirit), Son (blood) and Holy Spirit (water/body). 1John 5:8. Being part of the Lamb's book of life is being baptized into the body of the Lamb Himself. 
 
 Ron << In the Lamb's Book of Life is written the name of all the souls sent to earth to inhabit human bodies. I know it is preached that we have to work our way into the Book, but that preaching is incorrect. We work to keep our names in that Book - that Book which was written "before the foundation of the world".
 
 Terral's reply << No sir. We disagree. Truly, truly I have good news for you. What does Scripture say? "Therefore if you have been raised up with Christ, keep seeking the things above, where Christ is, seated at the right hand of God. Set your mind on the things above, not on the things that are on earth. For you have died and your life is hidden with Christ in God. When Christ, who is our life, is revealed, then you also will be revealed with Him in glory." Col. 3:1-4.
 
 A member of the body of Christ means being saved now and forever. It is not that we reached up to grasp His hand, but He reached down to take ours. "Who will separate us from the love of Christ? Will tribulation, or distress, or persecution, or famine, or nakedness, or peril, or sword?" Rom. 8:35. No sir. Nothing can remove us from the glory He has given us through Christ. We have been "sealed for the day of redemption." Eph. 4:30. You are confusing the gift of God through Paul's gospel with the New Covenant for the bride of Christ. They shall be joined with us 'in' Christ after the marriage supper of the Lamb. Rev. 19:5-10. We are members of His body already. 1Cor. 12:27.
 
 Ron << What happens to those whose names are blotted out of the Book of Life? They are thrown into the "lake of fire" or "hell" or out of the presence of God, where they die the final death and are gone.
 
 Terral's reply << We are to judge the world and the angels. 1Cor. 6:2+3. And we are part of the judgment process that occurs in Rev. 20:11-15. People today fail to realize just how lucky we are to have the opportunity to accept Paul's gospel. Scripture says, "But God, being rich in mercy, because of His great love with which He loved us, even when we were dead in our transgressions, made us alive together with Christ (by grace you have been saved), and raised us up with Him, and seated us with Him in the heavenly {places} in Christ Jesus, so that in the AGES TO COME He might show the surpassing riches of His grace in kindness toward us in Christ Jesus." Eph. 2:4-7. God is teaching the rulers and the authorities in the heavenly the lessons about the power of His grace (Eph. 3:1-11 (10). 
 
 Did you catch the key phrase there? "seated us with Him." Seated is finished product. We cannot add to what God has already finished and hidden in Himself in Christ.
 
 God bless,
 
 Terral

Ron << So God reformed the earth, built it back up to its former beauty, but then created a place called Eden where He would put His new creation: MAN (Adam). 
 
 Terral’s reply << We disagree here. Our current creation (Gen. 1:2 darkness; void state) exists in a broken form that is nothing like the Genesis 1:1 creation. The pre-fall creation existed without death and suffering of any kind at all. The current stars and planets were not part of that creation, as everything was made out of a kind of light that is not present in this fallen universe. The wave/particle (186,000 mps) light form we have today is a mere shadow of the light/life essence of the perfect creation of Genesis 1:1. Beings of that perfect creation could travel from one end of the universe to the other in no time at all. The limitations of this current universe are based upon its broken condition.

 I realize that. I was referring to perfection as it relates to man. If we remove the physical portion, how the earth was at the time of Eden, it voids my topic…or at least takes away its full function.
 
Ron wrote << In the center of Eden God placed a “tree”, which was a form of hierarchy, a physical conduit of the knowledge of good and evil. 
 
 Terral’s reply << Adam was to be rule over creation forever from the newly fashioned Eden environment that joined both the heavens and earth. The reconciliation process that shall be completed through Christ (Col. 1:20), was to take place through this perfect Adam. The fall of Adam left Satan as ‘the prince of the power of the air.’ Eph. 2:2. Remember that God sends the deluding influence (Satan) to serve His purposes. 2Thes. 2:10-12 (10). Satan is the ‘anointed cherub who covers.’ Eze. 28:14. In the perfect realm of Genesis 1:1, all beings were created knowing all things. Therefore, the job of these select cherubs was to cover those things which God (or Adam as ruler of this realm) wished to hide from anyone. The “tree was good for food, and that it was a delight to the eyes, and that the tree was desirable to make {one} wise.” Gen. 3:6. 
 
 Satan was a tool to be used, but not to be taken internally. This is why God did not want Adam to taste of this fruit. Gen. 2:17. Pre-fall Adam existed in the singularity form of pre-fall Genesis 1:1, which we have little ability to comprehend today. He had no concept of good or evil. Everything simply existed. Can we imagine how a woman can be taken out of a man? No. And yet, that is what our Bible says. Anyway, the ‘kingdom of heaven’ could not come to this realm through Adam, as he was subjected to futility in the same way as creation. Everything that Adam could not do, the Second Adam is doing by the will of God.

 Good point. Well said.
 
Ron << God commanded mankind not to reach for that status, for it would literally thrust them into death. Now the devil, being the liar that he is, told man that God was lying about the “tree” and convinced them to partake, which they did, unfortunately.
 
 Terral’s reply << Not exactly. Paul writes, “And {it was} not Adam {who} was deceived, but the woman being deceived, fell into transgression.” 1Tim. 2:14.

 It was mankind – both are to blame, both chose Evil over Good. If a person looks closely at that passage, Satan is one “tree” and Christ is the other. Both partook, even though Eve was the first.
 
Ron << In the Lamb’s Book of Life is written the name of all the souls sent to earth to inhabit human bodies. I know it is preached that we have to work our way into the Book, but that preaching is incorrect. We work to keep our names in that Book – that Book which was written “before the foundation of the world”.
 
 Terral’s reply << No sir. We disagree. Truly, truly I have good news for you. What does Scripture say? “Therefore if you have been raised up with Christ, keep seeking the things above, where Christ is, seated at the right hand of God. Set your mind on the things above, not on the things that are on earth. For you have died and your life is hidden with Christ in God. When Christ, who is our life, is revealed, then you also will be revealed with Him in glory.” Col. 3:1-4.
 
 A member of the body of Christ means being saved now and forever. It is not that we reached up to grasp His hand, but He reached down to take ours. “Who will separate us from the love of Christ? Will tribulation, or distress, or persecution, or famine, or nakedness, or peril, or sword?” Rom. 8:35. No sir. Nothing can remove us from the glory He has given us through Christ. We have been “sealed for the day of redemption.” Eph. 4:30. You are confusing the gift of God through Paul’s gospel with the New Covenant for the bride of Christ. They shall be joined with us ‘in’ Christ after the marriage supper of the Lamb. Rev. 19:5-10. We are members of His body already. 1Cor. 12:27.

 The Book of Life contains the names of those who have a choice this time either to choose good or evil. If they choose evil, their names are blotted out. That’s what I was referring to. Other than that I agree. Once we are sealed, we are sealed. But, remember: God allows us to make that choice. (I use “us” referring to mankind in general) Before some people are born, God hates them due to them siding with Lucifer during the War. (Read Romans chapter 9)
 
Romans chapter 9
 Verse 8 – That is, those who are the children of the flesh, these are not the children of God; but the children of the promise are counted as seed.
 Verse 11 – (for the children not yet being born, nor having done any good or evil, the purpose of God according to election might stand, not of works but of Him who calls),
 Verse 12 – it was said to her (Sarah), “The older shall serve the younger.”
 Verse 13 – As it is written, “Jacob I have loved, but Esau I have hated.” (Malachi 1: 2 and 3)

 
 God hates those that tried to “murder” Him in the War. To those He will show no mercy; they have already made their decision.
